entry.title: Assigning a new tax key for and VAT 26.000 not possible
entry.content:
Dear Friends,

This error is faced by the user. We are in ECC 6.0.

Could you please help me to setup below partners in SAP, so  vendor invoices are posted correctly? All below partners needs to recognize VAT at 26% rate and Tax code N3.

Vendor CoCode VAT Rate
258561 2489  26.000
257700 2489 26.000
245671 2489 26.000

Assigning a new tax key for and VAT 26.000 not possible

Message No. FD008

Diagnosis

In Financial Accounting customizing, the tax ID transferred in the invoice is missing so that the system cannot determine a tax code. The system could not determine an entry with the value nor with the value VAT 26.000.

Procedure

In Financial Accounting customizing, include the external tax ID and a corresponding internal tax code for the present partner.

Please suggest, what are the T.codes that needs to be checked and configured? 

Regards

Sridhar

entry.title: Custom Fields Added in TMR1,TM00,TX-3,TPM13 and S_ALR_87015205
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We have added two custom fields in the FTR_CREATE screen under the custom Additional tab and are saving the data in the VTBFHA table. The data is reflected correctly in the VTBFHA table and custom Append Structure VTMFHA

These two fields also need to be included in the following reports:

  • TMR1
  • TM00
  • TX-3
  • S_ALR_87015205
  • TPM13

Currently:

  • In TM00, the custom fields are displayed, and values are appearing correctly.
  • In the other reports mentioned above, the fields are not showing, and values are not appearing correctly.
  • Additionally, in TM00, the Dynamic Selection option is greyed out. Could you please advise me on how to activate the Dynamic Selection for this report?

Requesting your support to:

  1. Add the two custom fields in the above-listed reports.
  2. Help resolve the Dynamic Selection activation issue in TM00.

 I have attached detail document please refer to attached and provide the your valuable solution

entry.title: Issue with Cost Center linked to incorrect Profit Center in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (3SL, CBC)
entry.content:
Dear SAP community,

We are working with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (3SL, CBC) and created a cost center ES015393 in the Manage Cost Centers Fiori app. During its creation, it was accidentally linked to the wrong profit center ES015394.

SAP Support advised us to:

  • Create a new cost center and link it to the correct profit center. 

  • Align the valid-from date of the new cost center with the valid-to date of the incorrect one. 

However, this did not resolve the issue.

Problem:

When creating new asset postings for the corrected cost center, we face the error: “Cost center has different profit centers; therefore it cannot be used.”

This happens when creating a fixed asset and filling the cost center field in the Manage Fixed Assets app. According to SAP Support, the only current alternative is to create different cost centers for each profit center and use those in Asset Accounting (AA).

Challenge:

Each cost center/profit center represents one of our locations. Our cost center structure is integrated across our organization (HR system, CRM, etc.). Creating a completely new cost center number is not a feasible option.

References checked:

  • Asset Accounting – Time-Dependent Master Data (SAP Help)

  • SAP Note 3576469 – Error message ‘Cost center has different profit centers’

Question:
Has anyone faced this or a similar scenario before? If so, how did you resolve it while keeping the cost center structure intact?

 

Thanks in advance for your support!

 

Best Regards,


Mike van Ingen
Finance

entry.title: Excluding Down Payments from CO Value Type 12 on WBS Elements
entry.content:
Hello,

I would appreciate your help regarding the following topic:

Is it possible to exclude down payments (value type 12) from being activated in CO (on WBS elements)?

My requirement is not to track down payments in Controlling. In this case, would it be sufficient not to maintain any customizing in OKEP and KANK (for business transaction KAZO), or is there another step required?

Currently, when I try to skip maintaining cost elements in OKEP, I encounter the following error message:

"Maintain default cost element in controlling area XXX" (Message no. FI660)

I attempted to apply SAP Note 388843 in our system (SAP S/4HANA 2023, version S4H2023_A4H_23). However, the following message appears:

"SAP Note does not contain valid correction instructions (Message no. SCWN002)"
Diagnosis: The corrections in this SAP Note are not valid for the release and Support Package level of your system. This implies that the described issue either does not occur in your system anymore, or it has already been resolved through a Support Package. In some cases, the error cannot be fixed by an SAP Note correction.
System Response: The system cannot implement the SAP Note.
Procedure: Follow the recommendations provided in the SAP Note text.

I also tried to adjust the code manually in transaction SE38, but unfortunately without success.

Has anyone faced a similar situation or found a workaround to prevent down payments from posting to CO without configuring default cost elements?

Could someone please explain why this is considered standard behavior in SAP, and what the objective of posting a down payment in Controlling (CO) is?

Thank you in advance for your guidance.

Best regards,

entry.title: TDS Limit in SAP Based on total invoice amount for fiscal year done.
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I got a requirment from business which is i got find to done with customization with the help of enhancement,

Purpose / Objective:

The purpose of this Business requirment implementing a TDS (Tax Deducted at Source) threshold limit configuration in SAP.
Currently, the system deducts TDS on every invoice amount without checking the cumulative transaction value for each vendor at PAN.

This leads to incorrect or non-compliant deductions.

The objective of this development is to ensure that TDS is deducted only after the total transaction value for a PAN exceeds the statutory threshold limit (₹50,00,000) within a financial year.

Business Requirement

TDS should be deducted only when the cumulative invoice/payment value for a vendor PAN in a financial year exceeds ₹50,00,000.
The system must check the total amount posted for each vendor PAN from the start of the fiscal year (April) and apply TDS only when the threshold is crossed.

 

Functional Requirements:

 

TABLE

Description

INPUT Logic.

FIELD

OUTPUT                               

LFA1

Fetch Vendor by Vendor PAN detail.

Vendor PAN

J_1IPANNO

Vendor Code of same PAN

LFBW

Pass Vendor Code and get the vendor with withholding tax type 194Q-4Q

Vendor Code which I got from LFA1(J_1IPANNO)

WITHT

Vendor Details which only have TDS type 194Q-4Q

As a Functional i have created the logic but i am confuged with from which table i can pick vendor invoice amount( which is final net amount after all kind of case which can reduce vendor invoice line item except vendor payment) I triend with BSEG, But BSEG is very big table, It will not work with BSEG. Please help me with the other solution other than BSEG, I avoid BSEG here, If only BSEG help here please give a clear logic. But provide any other solution.

entry.title: Questions on EBS SAP Public cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts, 

We are encountering two issues in the Electronic Bank Statement process in SAP Public Cloud:

  1. We are unable to use document type ZR instead of SA.

  2. The system is not clearing entries automatically after uploading the bank statement. One entry posts correctly, but an additional entry is generated that debits and credits the clearing account. As a result, the amount in the main bank account remains uncleared.

entry.title: Fi-AA: accumulated depreciation balance sheet account not cleared
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

I have a problem/question related to SAP FI-AA (S4HANA 2508). I am posting an asset aquisition of 1.000,00 EUR on 01/09/2025 to GL account 240000000. Afterwards I am doing a depreciation run on 30/09/2025 where 20,00 EUR is posted to my balance sheet account for accumulated depreciations 240000080. This depreciation run is posted in GL.

I am doing now a scrapping without revenue on 15/10/2025. I would expect that my balance of both balance sheet account gets cleared:

- Credit asset account 240000000: 1.000 EUR

- Debit asset account accumulated depreciation 240000080: 20,00 EUR

-Debit loss account: 980,00 EUR

Unfortunatelly it does not clear my accumulated depreciation account. My posting is:

- Credit asset account 240000000: 1.000 EUR

- Debit loss account: 1.000,00 EUR

Why does it not take the old historically posted depreciation into consideration?

br,Stef
